removals.reasoning: The outer parentheses around the cast result are redundant in a function argument. The cast must remain (double*)A, but the extra surrounding parentheses can be removed without changing semantics.
Same as line 150: extra outer parentheses around the cast in the function argument are unnecessary.
Same as line 150: redundant outer parentheses around a cast used as a function argument.
The outer parentheses around the cast expression are redundant. Keep the casts, but remove the extra grouping parentheses.
Inner cast expression used inside the larger cast has redundant outer parentheses; (double*)A is sufficient.
Parentheses around the index expression are unnecessary; array subscripting already accepts the expression without extra grouping.
The parentheses around the cast operand when it's a single variable are redundant; (double)i is the conventional, equivalent form.
One set of parentheses around the addition is needed to make the cast apply to the sum; the doubled parentheses are redundant. Use (double)(j + 2).
Parentheses around the cast operand when it's a single variable are redundant; prefer (double)n.

There are several redundant outer grouping parentheses around the whole RHS. Keep the single necessary grouping for the numerator of the division and normalized casts; remove the extra layers of parentheses which do not affect precedence.
